header: I Could Boast In My Visions And Revelations From The Lord

verse: It-is-necessary to boast. It is not beneficial, but I will come to visions and revelations from the Lord.
I know a man in Christ, fourteen years ago— whether in the body, I do not know, or outside of the body, I do not know. God knows— that such a one was snatched-away to the third heaven.
And I know such a man— whether in the body or apart from the body, I do not know. God knows—
that he was snatched away into paradise, and heard unspeakable words which are not permitted for a man to speak.
I will boast on behalf of such a one. But I will not boast on behalf of myself, except in the weaknesses.

For if I should desire to boast, I will not be foolish, for I will be speaking the truth; but I am sparing you, that no one might credit to me beyond what he sees as to me, or hears as to something from me.

header: But God’s Power Is Perfected In Weakness, So I Will Boast In My Weaknesses

verse: And for the excess of the revelations— for-this-reason, in order that I might not be exalted, a thorn in the flesh was given to me; a messenger of Satan to beat me in order that I might not be exalted.
I appealed-to the Lord about this three-times, that it might depart from me.

And He has said to me: “My grace is sufficient for you. For My power is perfected in weakness”. Therefore most-gladly I will rather boast in my weaknesses in order that the power of Christ may dwell upon me.
For this reason I am well-pleased with weaknesses, with insults, with constraints, with persecutions and distresses for the sake of Christ. For whenever I am weak, at that time I am powerful.

header: I Ought To Be Commended By You, For I Did The Signs of The Apostle Among You

verse: I have become foolish— you compelled me! For I ought to be being commended by you! For I in no way came-short-of the superlative apostles, even though I am nothing;
the signs of the apostle were produced among you in all endurance in both signs and wonders, and miracles.

header: My Only Shortcoming Is Not Letting You Pay Me! I Will Gladly Spend Myself For You!

verse: For what is it as to which you were worse-off  than the other churches?— except that I myself did not burden you. Forgive me this wrong-doing!

Behold— this is the third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be a burden. For I am not seeking your things, but you. For the children ought not to be storing-up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
But I will most gladly spend and be expended for your souls— though while loving you more, I am loved less!

header: And Everyone I Sent You Did The Same As I

verse: But let it be— I did not weigh you down, but being crafty, I took you by deceit!
As to anyone of whom I have sent-out to you— I did not exploit you through him, did I ?
I urged Titus to go, and I sent the brother with him. Titus did not exploit you, did he? Did we not walk in the same spirit? In the same footsteps?

header: In All This I Am Speaking To Edify You, Lest I Should Have To Come And Mourn Over You

verse: All-this-time are you thinking that we are defending-ourselves to you? We are speaking before God in Christ— and speaking all things, beloved, for the sake of your edification.

For I am fearing that having come, I may somehow find you to be not such as I want and I may be found by you to be such as you do not want— that somehow there may be strife, jealousy, rages, selfish-interests, slanders, whisperings, puffings [with pride], disorders;

that I having come again, my God should humble me before you, and I should mourn many of the ones having previously-sinned and not having repented over the impurity and sexual-immorality and sensuality which they practiced.
